Test Name: Myeloma, High Risk with Reflex Probes, Diagnostic FISH Evaluation
Specimen Type: Bone marrow aspirate (preferred) or blood sample
Purpose: To detect chromosomal abnormalities associated with high-risk myeloma using fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH), with reflex probes applied when initial abnormalities are found.
Equipment: Fluorescence microscope, Class II biosafety cabinet, centrifuge, slide warmer, fume hood, refrigerator
